name: places/ChIJ2x9X5b1ZwokRcpKXJFMeUFU
adrFormatAddress: 56 7th Ave, New York, NY 10011-6672, USA

originalText.text: Pharmacist Steve went above and beyond to make sure I got my medication. Can't thank him or the good folks at Elm enough. Pharmacists are usually very helpful from my experience, but they truly went above and beyond.

text.text: Pharmacist Steve went above and beyond to make sure I got my medication. Can't thank him or the good folks at Elm enough. Pharmacists are usually very helpful from my experience, but they truly went above and beyond.

originalText.text: The pharmacist Elana is an aweful money hungy liar. Use to love going there years back until i wanted my husband and my specialty meds sent to a different pharmacy. She never transferred those meds and we had to go through a lot to get new scripts somewhere else. She even accused us of selling our medications. Years go by and we decide to try them for just our psychiatric meds because they come a little faster from Elms. Well our doctor accidently sent my husbands speciality med to them. Pharmacist Eva (same attitude as Elana) said she transferred it to my specialty pharmacy. She didnt. Then i spoke to Elana and the rude nastiness came out of her again as she lied and said she s not able to transfer his script to anywhere because of medicaid. Thats a complete falcity. They make a lot of money off our specialty meds and once it gets in elms hands theyll do whatever it takes to hold onto that. So again we had to travel to revisit our doctor to have  new scripts sent to our specialty pharmacy. Im tired of the tricks they pull and i dont care what their response is to my review. Best of luck to you too elms. NOT!

originalText.text:
Have been shopping here for years for health food/store needs from foods, supplements etc
I can’t speak to the pharmacy (my insurance doesn’t cover Rx’s filled there), but I have loved this store for the past decade
Relatively fair prices for Chelsea/West Village area - discounts available on every purchase with an account
Neighborhood Gem

originalText.text: Pharmacy "closes at 7" with the pharmacy closed at 6:45. Weak business that racially profiles

text.text: Pharmacy "closes at 7" with the pharmacy closed at 6:45. Weak business that racially profiles

originalText.text: The pharmacist Elena, is completely nasty. I’m currently relocating from New York to Jersey. So I used this pharmacy until I can transfer my health insurance to a different state. When I used them the first time they were able to fedex my medicine to my address in Jersey at MY expense . I called the following month and I asked them to overnight it, the representative agreed and confirmed my address. But I noticed I wasn’t charged for shipping, so I called to inquire why it wasn’t shipped. Elena got on the phone and she was so rude about explaining her process of when they decide to ship your medicine and when they don’t. Not once did she apologize for the LACK of communication on the pharmacy’s behalf. She did, however, apologize for me not being aware of their shipping process (which they failed to explain in the first place). She also asked in the most condescending way possible  why I didn’t have a pharmacy in Jersey. She proceeded to say that it makes no sense for me to have a pharmacy in NYC, not fully understanding my situation of relocating. My experience with Elena was a rude, insensitive and imposing one. I wouldn’t recommend her as a pharmacist to anyone. It’s small size businesses like her who lack basic customer service skills, that make it easy to keep supporting big chain businesses like Walgreens
